Replace.Text: [COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_LION_OF_MALI_DESCRIPTION]Wants to be the civilization with the most [ICON_Tourism] Tourism, dislikes those who compete in [ICON_Tourism] Tourism.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_LION_OF_MALI_NAME]Lion of Mali

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_MAAT_DESCRIPTION]Clears all features and improves all possible tiles. Likes civilizations with a high percentage of improved tiles. Dislikes civilizations with low percentage of improved tiles or that found National Parks.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_MAAT_NAME]Ma'at
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_PREFER_FOOD_DESCRIPTION]Tries to build up [ICON_Food] Food, and likes civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Food] Food.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_AGENDA_PREFER_FOOD_NAME]Basilike Ge
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]So it shall be; a union as of Osiris and Isis!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Our deeds are nothing without a friend to tell the tale!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]It is done. A partnership between the black land of Horus and yours.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]A great king forgets nobody.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Your delegation has seen the wonders of my realm. They might be a bit sad to come home.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]We have spent the night listening to the songs of the griot and dreaming of the time of heroes. Which is now.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]So let it be written. So let it be done.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]I am happy to agree.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Wander our lands, but know they are not your own.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_ACCEPT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]I wandered these lands as a boy, that you may do so now.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Shall you be a friend to the eternal kingdom?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]You cannot chose your relatives, but we may choose our friends. I choose you.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Look upon my armies, ye mighty, and despair.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]After the war of mouths, swords must decide.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Fire your arrows at the sun. Strike your swords against the flood. It will have the same effect.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DECLARE_WAR_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]As long as I breathe, Mali will never be your thrall.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Defeat me, but my monuments will stand over the glory that was Ramses, king of kings.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Alas, my city, my home, is now a place for the guinea fowl and partridge bathe in the dust.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DEFEAT_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DELEGATION_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DELEGATION_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DELEGATION_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I bring to you a small glimpse of the wonders of Egypt: jewels of gold and lapis, ivory and bone. These cost many deben, but we have them in abundance.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DELEGATION_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]My kingdom is not yet rich - perhaps my grandchildren may make it so. But we send to you lamb in peanut butter stew, that we call tiguadege na, and a leopard-skin chair to sit upon while you eat.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I shall let you rave on, that all will know you to be mad. (Denounces You)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]They call me a lion. I have heard you called a jackal. (Denounces You)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Did a jackal bark, just now?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_DENOUNCE_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]A serpent that remains hidden will grow old. You have revealed yourself.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I am Ramses, beloved of Amun. Every country trembles before me, fear in their hearts.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]I am Sundiata Keita, my light overleaps the mountains and shines out from Mali upon the world.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NEAR_INITIATOR_POSITIVE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NEAR_INITIATOR_POSITIVE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NEAR_INITIATOR_POSITIVE_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Yes
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NEAR_INITIATOR_POSITIVE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Agreed!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NO_MANS_INFO_EXCHANGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NO_MANS_INFO_EXCHANGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NO_MANS_INFO_EXCHANGE_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I can tell you of the heart of the sun, and the eternal change of the rivers. And you can tell me of wherever you're from.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_NO_MANS_INFO_EXCHANGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]You have heard the songs echoing across the plains, no? Shall we tell you their source?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_VISIT_RECIPIENT_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_VISIT_RECIPIENT_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_VISIT_RECIPIENT_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I invite you to visit our lands, though you will despair to see its glory, and salt the river with your tears.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_FIRST_MEET_VISIT_RECIPIENT_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Here, you may hear the griots' song directly from their mouths!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_GREETING_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_GREETING_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_GREETING_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]How does it feel to stand in my presence? To stand so close to the sun?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_GREETING_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Welcome, welcome!
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_KUDO_EXIT_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]All of our grand divine aspirations begin with a bit of bread, is it not so?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_KUDO_EXIT_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]We build that our name will not die out.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_KUDO_EXIT_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Wisdom is contained in words, songs, and stories - the words, songs and stories of Mali.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_KUDO_LEADER_ANY_REASON_AGENDA_HIGH_FOOD]I am impressed with how well you feed your people.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_KUDO_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_REASON_ANY](Your are strong in food production)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_ALLIANCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_ALLIANCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_ALLIANCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]The red and white crown shine ever brighter when they are combined into one.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_ALLIANCE_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]We will announce this bond to the assembled warriors.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_ACCEPT_DEAL_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_ACCEPT_DEAL_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_ACCEPT_DEAL_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]The flood abates.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_ACCEPT_DEAL_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Let the hunters return to the savannah. They are happier there.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_REFUSE_DEAL_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_REFUSE_DEAL_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_REFUSE_DEAL_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]The lioness of war still rages through the land. I cannot call her back.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_AI_REFUSE_DEAL_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]A wounded snake may still strike. One must stamp it out.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Sekhmet has drunk enough. Shall we agree to peace?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MAKE_PEACE_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Dawn comes, and the lion sleeps.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MODIFIER_DESCRIPTION_HIGH_FOOD]They are pleased to see another well fed civilization
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_MODIFIER_DESCRIPTION_LOW_FOOD]They dislike civilizations with low food
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]We have need to pass through your lands and ask only that your people not gaze upon our troops, lest they be blinded by their radiance.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]We travel far. Will you ease our passage?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]We have no peer.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Kings forget their humility. It is only natural.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]To sit at the same table? To agree as equals? I think not.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]A great king forgets nobody.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]The cobra's scales shine like gems in the sun. But we do not desire to grasp it. So it is with your gifts.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DELEGATION_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]I do not have the time to escort foreigners about my kingdom.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_DECLARE_FRIEND_FROM_AI_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]I deny you this.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_MAKE_DEAL_FROM_AI_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]This we cannot do.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Egypts borders remain walls of stone to you.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_REJECT_OPEN_BORDERS_FROM_HUMAN_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Alas, no. There are lions.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_EXIT_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]I hear your people make a porridge of ashes and twigs. Tell me, is that true?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_EXIT_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]Do you think that you can cultivate sand?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_EXIT_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]With your people, everyone thinks that they know the true stories, but true wisdom is held in memory.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_LEADER_ANY_REASON_AGENDA_LOW_FOOD]You are not doing much to prevent your population from growing. What do your people eat?
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_REASON_ANY](Your food production is lacking)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_TOO_MANY_TROOPS_NEAR_ME_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_ANY]{LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_TOO_MANY_TROOPS_NEAR_ME_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ANY}

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_TOO_MANY_TROOPS_NEAR_ME_LEADER_RAMSES_ANY]The sun does not abide other lights in the sky when it shines. So I cannot abide your forces near me.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_DIPLO_WARNING_TOO_MANY_TROOPS_NEAR_ME_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_ANY]Your warriors stray far from their hunting grounds.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_CHAPTER_CAPSULE_BODY][ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture flow down the great Nile River while playing as Ptolemaic Cleopatra.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_CHAPTER_DETAILED_BODY]Make sure you settle cities with lots of Rivers and Floodplains when playing as Ptolemaic Cleopatra. Settling next to rivers with her leading Egypt provide everything a civilization that stands the test of time needs: [ICON_Production] Production, [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Food] Food, and Appeal. The Iteru ability gives [ICON_Production] Production and protection from Floods on these river-adjacent cities as well. Her leader ability gives [ICON_Culture] Culture, Appeal, and [ICON_FOOD] Food for river cities. Even more [ICON_Culture] Culture for river cities is found if you can solve the riddle of the Sphinx (that is to say, by constructing them). Culture Victory is Cleopatra’s main focus with [ICON_Culture] Culture coming from the Sphinx and her leader ability.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_QUOTE]All strange and terrible events are welcome, but comforts we despise.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_ALT_TITLE]Cleopatra (Ptolemaic)
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_CLEOPATRA_TITLE]Cleopatra (Egyptian)

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_CAPSULE_BODY]Who says that wonders are their own reward? So it is with Ramses, who gets large amounts of [Icon_Culture] Culture for completing wonders and a small amount for finishing buildings.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_DETAILED_BODY]With a nice river start, Egypt gains bonuses towards wonders and districts. Wonders are a great source of [Icon_Culture] Culture with Ramses’ Abu Simbel ability that gives 30% of the construction cost as [Icon_Culture] Culture. The Sphinx then gives even more [Icon_Culture] Culture if placed adjacent to these Wonders. The Maryannu Chariot Archer will protect Egypt while they focus on construction, leading to a Culture Victory.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_1]Iconic for the New Kingdom of Egypt, Ramses’s reign is marked not by anything distinctive but by a series of exemplary moments – military conquests, monumental architecture, etc. Here is the arrogance and might of the pharaoh made flesh.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_2]Many of our leaders come from obscurity to greatness. Pachacuti was the second son of a royal dynasty and was never intended to lead the Inca. Cleopatra was the subject of a foreign kingdom that rose into rebellion. Not so with Ramses, the son of Seti.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_3]While Seti’s family was not originally royal, they emerged in the wake of the social and religious upheaval of Akhenaten, who sought to create a new religious order and under whose rule (and subsequent rule of Tutankhamun), Egypt’s foreign borders declined. Seti sought to correct this – expanding Egyptian power to end the Hittite domination of the Levan and re-establishing Egypt as a far-flung empire whose borders extended far beyond the Nile. Ramses showed promise early, and his father appointed him as regent at the age of ten. Seti’s reconsolidation of Egyptian power was outward-looking in other ways, incorporating Syrian deities into the thought-to-be monolithic and conservative Egyptian state.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_4]In his early years, Ramses sent warriors to subdue Libya and retake Syria from the Hittites and, in a brilliant strategical maneuver against Sardinian pirates, captured the entirety of the rebel fleet by allowing them certain victories that lulled them into complacency. Another significant point in his expansion was the Battle of Kadesh (in Syria), where an overextended Egyptian force, personally led by the pharaoh, almost captured the city of Kadesh, under Hittite rule, but then was forced to retreat. What might have been a demoralizing defeat turned into victory, as the Egyptians used the time to rethink their strategies and push the war to a draw. The resultant peace treaty became the balance of power in the region.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_5]At home, Ramses embarked on a construction spree, most notably the temples at Ramesseum and Abu Simbel, ensuring that his name – often under its Greek version, Osymandyas (Ozymandias in Percey Shelley's celebrated poem) – lived through the ages.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_6]Ramses died well into his nineties, giving Egypt nearly seven decades with him on the throne. His name is now synonymous with Egyptian power, arrogance, and might (rightly or wrongly).
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_QUOTE]I have been granted sheaves of wheat like sand, buildings that approach heaven, and grain heaps like mountains.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_RAMSES_TITLE]Ramses II

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_CAPSULE_BODY]Sundiata Keita’s wealth is not as great as his descendant, but it is still large enough to compete with Russia’s quest for Great Writers.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_DETAILED_BODY]The two things Sundiata Keita is best at are [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing. Mali’s Songs of the Jeli hurts his [ICON_Production] Production, but gives back in [ICON_Gold] Gold generation. He receives even more [ICON_Gold] Gold from the Suguba’s adjacency bonuses and Mandekalu Cavalry’s [ICON_Gold] Gold from kills. Sundiata Keita’s epic ability to purchase Great People cheaper is best focused on purchasing Great Writers who can create even more powerful [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing. Culture Victory is the best purchase Sundiata Keita can make.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_1]The Malian Empire arose from the ashes of Ghana (Wagadou). Mali existed as a small state on the edges of the Sahel, that arid region at the southern fringe of the Sahara. But as Wagadou collapsed, these smaller powers saw their chance. And, for Mali, around 1230, it was Sundiata Keita, the Lion of Mali, on whose shoulders this burden fell.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_2]According to the Epic of Sundiata, the Lion’s origins were not auspicious. His mother, Sogolon, was a commoner unflatteringly called “the buffalo woman.” But this was part of the point; according to prophecy, if the Mande king Nare Maghann Konate married such a person, she would bear a great king.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_3]Sundiata was, in this way, born to Konate and Sogolon. He was not well-liked – he acquired his looks from his mother, and, further, his physical condition was such that he was unable to walk throughout much of his childhood. Sundiata struggled as a young man against his condition as well as against the resentment of his half-brother, born of a fully noble line. He struggled to walk, breaking the iron rods that blacksmiths had forged for him, and only through the steady command of his mother (or, in some tellings, the strength of a baobab tree) he forced himself to move.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_4]But family struggles proved worse – upon the death of his father, Sundiata and Sogolon were exiled and wandered the Sahel seeking shelter. All tribes cast them out, except for one, the Mema kingdom. With shelter there, Sundiata learned to hunt and fight, and proved his worth.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_5]In his absence, things were developing in the region. Soumaoro Kante, a sorcerer-king, had arisen and began conquering the remnants of Wagadou. In fear, the Malian people sought for their exiled, prophesied king, and found him – it should be noted that the young king was only 18 at the time! Sundiata returned to Mali, united the scattered kingdoms, and defeated the sorcerer.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_6]This story, recorded in the “Epic of Sundiata”, has its biases. Later writings and tellings come mostly from Muslim sources and would be eager to cast any ruler following indigenous religions as a cruel and wicked sorcerer. Sundiata, in these stories, is a righteous Muslim king who founds a Muslim dynasty. But most Malians at Sundiata’s time were not Muslim, and his own religion was likely not Islam, though in just a generation or two, most of Mali’s elites were. Indeed, the explorer Ibn Battuta complains about the unorthodox practices at the Malian court nearly a hundred years later, though he notes that the nobles are all of the faith.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_7]Mali under Mansa [king] Sundiata was not of the extent and richness it would become under Musa, his great-nephew. Nonetheless, Sundiata created a federated monarchy in West Africa, where various vassal kingdoms would send representatives to speak for their people. It was the beginnings of the successors to Wagadou, successors that would include Mali itself, Songhai, and others.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_CHAPTER_HISTORY_PARA_8]Mansa Sundiata died young, likely during a failed river crossing. His tomb is hidden, as are all tombs of the Malian kings.

[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_QUOTE]But never try to pierce the mystery which Mali hides from you. Do not go into the dead cities to question the past, for the spirits never forgive. Do not seek to know what is not to be known.
[COLOR_RED]TRANSLATION MISSING[ENDCOLOR][LOC_PEDIA_LEADERS_PAGE_LEADER_SUNDIATA_KEITA_TITLE]Sundiata Keita
